roleset.name: extend for some period of time; duration
roleset.note: LAST-V NOTES: Frames file for 'last' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry 54.2, no indication of other framed members. No Framenet entry. No comparison. (from last.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: prepositional period
example.text: The turmoil in junk bonds may last for years, investors and traders say.

example.name: not prepositional
example.text: Some traders said the popularity of issues that gained yesterday won't last long, as investors will rotate their buying choices over the short term.
example.arg: the popularity of issues that gained yesterday
as investors will rotate their buying choices over the short term

roleset.name: later than/behind all other entities
roleset.note: LAST-J NOTES: Added automatically by Julia. Related to last.xml (from last.02-j)

example.text: Malaysia Airlines MH370: Co-pilot was last to communicate from cockpit.

roleset.name: of supplies or resources: be sufficient for a period of time

role.descr: how long the supplies/resources will last

roleset.note: The number of users typically implies a consumption rate.

example.name: food
example.text: This food will last us for at least three months.

example.name: oil reserves
example.text: BP eestimates that global oil reserves will last 53.3 years at the current production rates.

roleset.name: of products or people: function, survive for a period of time

role.descr: how long the product/person will function/survive
attribute of product/person that has a duration

example.name: car, with arg4
example.text: This well-built car will last you for a very long time.

example.name: coach
example.text: The new coach won't last a full season.

example.name: diet, with arg3
example.text: I only lasted 2 days on my diet.
